Uses of Interface
senselogic.sitevision.api.mail.MailBuilder

  • Packages that use MailBuilder 
    Package Description
    senselogic.sitevision.api.mail
    Mail utility interfaces

    • Uses of MailBuilder in senselogic.sitevision.api.mail

      Methods in senselogic.sitevision.api.mail that return MailBuilder 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      MailBuilder MailBuilder.addBlindCopyRecipient(String aBlindCopyRecipientAddress)
      Adds a blind carbon copy recipient address (BCC).
      MailBuilder MailBuilder.addCopyRecipient(String aCopyRecipientAddress)
      Adds a carbon copy recipient address (CC).
      MailBuilder MailBuilder.addRecipient(String aRecipientAddress)
      Adds a recipient address (TO).
      MailBuilder MailBuilder.addReplyTo(String aReplyToAddress)
      Adds a reply-to address.
      MailBuilder MailBuilder.clearAllRecipients()
      Convenience method for removing all addresses for all recipient types (TO/CC/BCC).
      MailBuilder MailBuilder.clearBlindCopyRecipients()
      Removes all previously added blind carbon copy recipient addresses (BCC).
      MailBuilder MailBuilder.clearCopyRecipients()
      Removes all previously added carbon copy recipient addresses (CC).
      MailBuilder MailBuilder.clearRecipients()
      Removes all previously added recipient addresses (TO).
      MailBuilder MailBuilder.clearReplyTos()
      Removes all previously added reply-to addresses.
      MailBuilder MailUtil.getMailBuilder()
      Returns a mail builder for creating mails.
      MailBuilder MailBuilder.setFrom(String aFromAddress)
      Sets the from address.
      MailBuilder MailBuilder.setHtmlMessage(String aHtmlMessage)
      Sets the html message.
      MailBuilder MailBuilder.setSubject(String aSubject)
      Sets the subject.
      MailBuilder MailBuilder.setTextMessage(String aTextMessage)
      Sets the text message.

Sitevision - Portal and Content Management Made Easy
Sitevision is an advanced Java enterprise portal product and a portlet container (JSR 286) that implements Java Content Repository (JSR 283).
